name: places/ChIJ0SBRB6hYwokRr3tmDsVhdk0

displayName.text: New York City Police Department 23 Precinct

formattedAddress: 164 E 102nd St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 164 E 102nd St, New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text: I have lived in East Harlem my entire life and have never really had any bad interactions with any of the officers from the 23rd Precinct. I have called the police several times to my place of work for help to which they always go above and beyond. These same officers even come back to see me and to receive medical care. Even in my own personal life I have had nothing but pleasant interactions with officers, so much so that I have left them treats to show my gratitude. However today I decided to call the precinct to ask for some advice regarding a current situation I was dealing with. PA Gibbs who is not a police officer answered the non-emergency line and was very nasty. She rushed me as I was trying to explain and gave me the NASTIEST energy I have ever received when dealing with the 23rd Precinct. She even yelled at me on the phone and told me to stop speaking. That is beyond unprofessional. After that I asked PA Gibbs if she can transfer me to someone else because I didn't feel as if she was being helpful. She forgets to put me on hold so I hear speaking to her collogues about me. Her tone was absolutely unacceptable. If you are going to say bad things the least you can do is put me on hold so I don't hear you. I was then transferred to Sergeant Paulo who was fantastic. He gave me such great advice without any type of attitude. I wish I could leave 5 stars however PA Gibbs was one of the WORST human interactions I have ever had. No one with that attitude should be working in ANY type of environment that deals with people let alone at a precinct where civilians go to and call for help. Absolutely ridiculous. Thank you to all of the officers that make a difference every day and never hesitate to help. You are all amazing and I thank you for your service.

originalText.text: Officer Henry is a dream to speak to,his compassion and kindness makes him a superb officer. I had a domestic Issue and he was an absolute Angel helping me calm down,he also advised me to speak to Jackie and she too was so sweet and helpful. I pray God blesses them! Thank you guys for your service

text.text: Officer Henry is a dream to speak to,his compassion and kindness makes him a superb officer. I had a domestic Issue and he was an absolute Angel helping me calm down,he also advised me to speak to Jackie and she too was so sweet and helpful. I pray God blesses them! Thank you guys for your service

originalText.text:
On Sat March 23 at 2:20 p.m. I was standing at the meter about to buy a ticket for my car and the parking enforcement officer Walks Behind Me and tries to put a ticket on my car..... this was in the realm of 8 seconds because I parked right next to the meter. "1 car length".

When I asked him if he thought it would be a good idea to ask the people next to the meter if they're about to buy a ticket for their car... his response was "we are not required to do that" ????

I said but don't you see a connection? There's a person next to the meter maybe you should ask them if they're about to buy a ticket?
>>>> his response is....." I don't see a connection."

This took place at 1654 3rd Avenue. West side of the street.

originalText.text:
I work at a school and I had to
Come in to write a report on a parent. I stood there for 30 minutes not one person asked if I needed assistance. Not one person asked if I was ok or if anyone was assisting me. I had to CALL while standing there to have the  switchboard operator tell me that I had to continue waiting until someone arrived at the desk. Meantime plenty of people walked the halls, officers having personal conversations  amongst themselves.  This precent is nothing like the 34 in Washington heights, thier customer service is excellent.  I respect cops but this precent is the reason WHY cops aren't liked. I'm sorry to
Say

originalText.text:
I am sure there are good cops at the precinct. But as a whole, I don't think they care much for the law abiding citizens.   I have filed numerous noise complaints concerning small groups of  drunken men who play loud music, do cook outs, shout obscenities, get into fights, harass women passersby, yet they rarely respond.  And if they do, they claim they did not observe anything.  I have multiple tapes to proof them wrong.

And so it is, I filed a complaint today (Sept. 8, 2017), here is the response: The Police Department responded to the complaint and with the information available observed no evidence of the violation at that time.

Too bad, I can't post the video I have of the event I complained about.  Everyone would disagree with the police response.  In fact, they are still out there. IAnd, I will continue to raise the issue.
